title: Part 671 - Additional Duties Of Counsel And The Court Clerk In Criminal Actions, In And Cplr Article 78 Proceedings, In Proceedings Instituted By Motion Made Pursuant To Cpl 440.10 Or 440.20 And Family Court Act Proceedings
content:
Part 671 - Additional Duties Of Counsel And The Court Clerk In Criminal Actions, In And Cplr Article 78 Proceedings, In Proceedings Instituted By Motion Made Pursuant To Cpl 440.10 Or 440.20 And Family Court Act Proceedings

State Regulations
§ 671.1 - Application
§ 671.2 - Duration of representation by counsel for defendant
§ 671.3 - Additional duties of defendant's counsel in the trial court
§ 671.4 - Additional duties of defendant's counsel in the Appellate Division or other intermediate appellate court
§ 671.5 - Additional duties of the court and the court clerk, where defendant appears pro se in the trial court
§ 671.6 - Additional duties of counsel for the People, where defendant appears pro se in appellate court on appeal in criminal action or proceeding instituted upon motion made pursuant to CPL 440.10 or 440.20
§ 671.7 - Additional duties of counsel for the People, where defendant appears pro se in appellate court on appeal in habeas corpus or CPLR article 78 proceeding
§ 671.8 - Repealed
§ 671.9 - Additional duties of the court and of defendant's counsel in connection with trial court transcripts
§ 671.10 - Duties of assigned counsel in the Surrogate's Court and the Family Court

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
